author: travelandtourworld.com
title: Flock of storks forces SIA plane to make emergency landing in Turkey - Travelandtourworld.comTravelandtourworld.com
text:
Flock of storks forces SIA plane to make emergency landing in Turkey Published on : Wednesday, August 19, 2015
Probably a flock of storks decided to announce their monopoly in the sky as they attacked a Singapore Airlines flight from Istanbulâ€™s Ataturk Airport on Monday. Singapore Airlines flight SQ391 carrying 255 passengers and 14 crew members had to return back to the airport with significant damage to both the engines and the nose cone.
The bird hit caused severe damage to the composite lid known as the randome, or radar dome, on the nose cone, as well as the engines. The pilots had to return to Ataturk Airport and landed an hour after takeoff.
The passengers were taken to the airport hotel and Singapore Airlines has announced that a new plane is being sent to Istanbul.
Technical crews from Turkish Airlines have begun repairs on the damaged plane.
